title: CLAUDE.md
text: secretbase R package providing fast, memory-efficient streaming hash functions encoding/decoding. implements: - SHA-256, SHA-3, Keccak cryptographic hash functions - SHAKE256 extendable-output function (XOF) - SipHash-1-3 pseudo-random function - Base64 encoding/decoding - Base58 encoding/decoding 4-byte double SHA-256 checksum (version byte prefix) hash functions support direct hashing strings/raw vectors streaming hashing files R objects serialization.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: **R Layer (R/*.R)**: - R/secret.R - Hash function interfaces (sha3, shake256, keccak, sha256, siphash13) - R/base.R - Base64 Base58Check encoding/decoding interfaces - R functions thin wrappers call C code via .Call() **C Layer (src/*.c)**: - src/secret.h - Header context structures constants - src/init.c - Package registration .Call interface - src/secret.c - SHA-3/SHAKE256/Keccak implementations (Mbed TLS based) - src/secret2.c - SHA-256 implementation (Mbed TLS based) - src/secret3.c - SipHash implementation (c-siphash based) - src/base.c - Base64 implementation (Mbed TLS based) - src/base2.c - Base58Check implementation (libbase58 based)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Streaming Serialization: hash functions support streaming R object serialization without materializing full serialized object memory. achieved : - Custom serialization callbacks feed data directly hash contexts - Always uses R serialization version 3, big-endian representation - Skips headers (first 6 bytes) portability across platforms File Hashing: Files read hashed 65536-byte chunks (SB_BUF_SIZE), allowing files larger available RAM hashed. Output Formats: convert parameter controls output format: - TRUE - character string (hex hashes, base64/base58 encoding) - FALSE - raw vector - NA - integer vector (hashes SHAKE256) unserialized object (base64/base58 decoding)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: mbedtls_sha3_context - SHA-3/SHAKE256/Keccak state (25 × 64-bit words) mbedtls_sha256_context - SHA-256 state (8 × 32-bit words + 64-byte buffer) CSipHash - SipHash state (4 × 64-bit v-registers + padding tracking) secretbase_context - Wrapper serialization streaming

title: Cryptographic Hash, Extendable-Output and Binary Encoding Functions
text: Fast memory-efficient streaming hash functions, binary encoding serialization. Hashes strings raw vectors directly. Stream hashes files can larger memory, well -memory objects R’s serialization mechanism. Implements SHA-256, SHA-3 ‘Keccak’ cryptographic hash functions, SHAKE256 extendable-output function (XOF), ‘SipHash’ pseudo-random function, base64 base58 encoding, ‘CBOR’ serialization.

title: Cryptographic Hash, Extendable-Output and Binary Encoding Functions
text: SHA-3 Secure Hash Standard published National Institute Standards Technology (NIST) 2015 doi:10.6028/NIST.FIPS.202. SHA-3 based Keccak algorithm, designed G. Bertoni, J. Daemen, M. Peeters G. Van Assche. SHA-256 Secure Hash Standard published NIST 2002 https://csrc.nist.gov/publications/fips/fips180-2/fips180-2.pdf. SHA-256, SHA-3, Keccak, base64 implementations based ‘Mbed TLS’ Trusted Firmware Project https://www.trustedfirmware.org/projects/mbed-tls. SipHash family pseudo-random functions Jean-Philippe Aumasson Daniel J. Bernstein published 2012 https://ia.cr/2012/351. [2] SipHash implementation based Daniele Nicolodi, David Rheinsberg Tom Gundersen https://github.com/c-util/c-siphash, turn based reference implementation Jean-Philippe Aumasson Daniel J. Bernstein released public domain https://github.com/veorq/SipHash. base58 implementation based ‘libbase58’ Luke Dashjr https://github.com/luke-jr/libbase58. CBOR implementation follows RFC 8949, “Concise Binary Object Representation (CBOR)”, available https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc8949.
